cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles ENE of Port Mansfield, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving west then bending WSW toward the lower Texas coast and northeastern Mexico
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Texas coast, near Baffin Bay/Corpus Christi

weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning Port Mansfield–Sargent TX; Hurricane Warning Port Mansfield–Mesquite Bay TX; Tropical-Storm Warning Barra el Mezquital MX–Port Mansfield and Mesquite Bay–High Island TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Lower and middle Texas coast from the mouth of the Rio Grande to High Island TX
weather_observation.wind: Only occasional gusts below gale force (under 35 mph) expected at Plaquemines Port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge or tide anomalies (<2 ft) possible due to distant onshore swell, but no significant inundation expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 3–5 inches of rain with locally higher amounts, giving a low-end flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and higher waves along exposed Gulf approaches to the port.
